intro: Saurauia setigera, commonly known as the red-stemmed evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Vietnam, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and dense clusters of small, dark green leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers, which are followed by small, fleshy berries. Saurauia setigera thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests.
